intro: Arcytophyllum ciliolatum, commonly known as the silky sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, typically in late spring to early summer. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures. Due to its ecological importance and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in dry gardens.
